mn127:2.1: For Pañcakaṅga and his role, see note on [mn59:1.3]().
mn127:4.6: At [mn43:29.5](), Mahākoṭṭhita asks Sāriputta a similar question about different meditative liberations.
mn127:5.1: “Without fail” renders _apaṇṇaka_, for which see note on [mn60:4.3](). It’s an unusual response. If _apaṇṇaka_ means literally a “set without a fifth”, Anuruddha might be punning on Pañcakaṅga’s name, which means, “a set of five items”.
mn127:7.1: “Limitless” is _appamāṇa_. This set of four meditations is known in later traditions as either the “divine meditations” (_brahmavihārā_) or the “immeasurables” (_appamaññā_).
mn127:13.1: BB follows the PTS reading _abhiya_, but  Malalasekera says in the *Dictionary of Pali Proper Names* that this is likely to be the same person as the Sabhiya Kaccāna at [sn44.1](). Since this reading is found in the MS edition I adopt it here.
mn127:13.5: BB has “By reason of the factor [responsible for rebirth]” for tadangena, but it is an idiom that appears in AN 9.33 without causal implication. If the answer was in terms of cause, the next question would not be necessary.
